exercises.instruction: Complete with an auxiliary verb only (do/does/did, have, be, can, will etc.).

items.prompt: Anna doesn’t eat meat, but her brother ____.
I didn’t complain, but my colleagues ____.
She hasn’t replied yet, but I ____.
They were very tired, and we ____ too.
I can’t come tonight, but my sister ____.
We might be late, but they ____.
He would never do that, but she ____.
I’ve seen that film, and my parents ____ too.

exercises.instruction: Reply to show interest or surprise. Use a short question with an auxiliary.

items.prompt: A: ‘I’ve just passed my driving test.’ B: ‘____?’

exercises.instruction: Complete the replies using so / neither / nor / (not) either.

items.prompt: A: ‘I don’t like crowded places.’ B: ‘____.’
A: ‘I can’t remember his name.’ B: ‘____.’
A: ‘I’ve never been to Iceland.’ B: ‘____.’
A: ‘I finished the report yesterday.’ B: ‘____.’
A: ‘I shouldn’t eat so much sugar.’ B: ‘____.’
A: ‘I didn’t enjoy the concert.’ B: ‘____.’

exercises.instruction: Answer using short phrases like I think so / I hope not / I’m afraid so etc.

items.prompt: ‘Will you be able to finish today?’ — ____.

exercises.instruction: Add the correct question tag.
Complete the sentences with a question tag (often used to ask for information or a favour).

items.prompt: You could give me a hand, ____.
You don’t know where Paul lives, ____.
You’ll call me when you arrive, ____.

exercises.instruction: Complete the special question tags: Let’s …, Don’t …, I’m …

items.prompt: Don’t forget to lock the door, ____.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with the -ing form of the verb in brackets.
Complete with a suitable verb in the -ing form. (Any correct verb + -ing that fits is acceptable.)

items.prompt: I don’t fancy ____ in heavy traffic.
We considered ____ for the job, but the salary was low.
They recommended ____ a table in advance.
I can’t stand ____ in the cold rain.
We avoided ____ about politics at dinner.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with the -ing form.

items.prompt: Don’t put off ____ (do) it. Just start now.
She went on ____ (talk) even after the bell.
He kept on ____ (ask) the same question.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences using verb + object + -ing.

items.prompt: I remember ____ (you / say) that you hated sushi.
I caught ____ (him / look) at my notes.
This song always makes ____ (me / think) of summer.

exercises.instruction: Complete with to + infinitive.
Complete with not to + infinitive.
Complete the sentences (dare / seem / appear / pretend / claim + infinitive).

items.prompt: He pretended ____ (be / work) when I arrived.
I didn’t dare ____ (tell) him the truth.

exercises.instruction: Complete with a question word + to + infinitive.

items.prompt: Can you show me how ____ (use) this app?
We haven’t decided where ____ (go) on holiday.
Tell me who ____ (call) if there’s a problem.

exercises.instruction: Complete with to + infinitive.

items.prompt: I learnt ____ (cook) this dish in Italy.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences (to + infinitive, sometimes with an object).

items.prompt: She expects ____ (the train / arrive) on time.
They would like ____ (we / stay) for dinner.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences (verb + object + to…).

items.prompt: The doctor advised ____ (him / rest) for a few days.
They warned ____ (us / not touch) the wires.
I invited ____ (her / join) us for lunch.
His friends persuaded ____ (him / apply) for the job.

exercises.instruction: Complete with the infinitive without to (make/let).

items.prompt: Don’t let the children ____ (play) near the road.
My parents didn’t let me ____ (stay) out late.
He let the dog ____ (sleep) on the sofa.
The teacher made us ____ (repeat) the sentence.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences (passive forms and ‘be made to’).

items.prompt: He was warned ____ (not / drive) so fast.
I was invited ____ (give) a short talk.
The kids were made ____ (clean) their room.
I was made ____ (stand) in the corner.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with the correct form (-ing or to + infinitive).

items.prompt: We can’t afford ____ (buy) a new car.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with -ing or to + infinitive (remember / regret / go on).

items.prompt: I remember ____ (lock) the door. I did it before I left.
Remember ____ (lock) the door when you go out.
We regret ____ (inform) you that your order is delayed.
She went on ____ (talk) even after the meeting ended.
After introducing himself, he went on ____ (explain) the plan.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences. In many cases, -ing and to + infinitive are both possible.

items.prompt: 1a) It started ____ (rain) while we were walking.
1b) It’s starting ____ (get) cold. Take a jacket.
1c) She began ____ (cry) when she heard the news.
1d) We started ____ (look) for a new flat.
1f) The engine began ____ (make) a strange noise.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with try + to… or try + -ing.

items.prompt: I tried ____ (lift) the box, but it was too heavy.
She tried ____ (call) you, but your phone was off.
He’s trying ____ (save) money for a new bike.
Try ____ (press) this button. It might work.
If you have trouble sleeping, try ____ (drink) less coffee.
We tried ____ (take) the early train, but we missed it.
I tried ____ (explain), but they didn’t listen.
For a headache, try ____ (lie) down for a while.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with need to… or need -ing.
Complete the sentences with help (to) + infinitive. Both forms are acceptable in many cases.

items.prompt: This app will help you ____ (learn) new words.
The guide helped us ____ (choose) a route.

exercises.instruction: Complete with can’t help + -ing (or can’t help it).

items.prompt: I couldn’t help ____ (laugh) at his joke.
She can’t help ____ (worry) about her kids.
He couldn’t help ____ (look) at his phone.
I can’t help it. I’m ____ (feel) nervous.
They couldn’t help ____ (smile) when they saw the photo.

exercises.instruction: Complete with -ing or to + infinitive (both can be correct in general meanings).
Complete the sentences. Use -ing for existing situations, and choose between like doing / like to do when needed.

items.prompt: I hated ____ (work) in that open-plan office.
I like ____ (swim) in the sea. It’s fun.
I like ____ (swim) early, before it gets crowded.
She likes ____ (be) alone when she studies.
I like ____ (cook) early, so dinner is ready by six.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences (would like/love/prefer + to… ; would mind + -ing).

items.prompt: I wouldn’t like ____ (miss) the last train.

exercises.instruction: Complete with would like/love/hate + to have done (regret about the past).

items.prompt: I’d like ____ (see) the old town, but we had no time.
I’d like ____ (go) with you, but I was ill.
I’d like ____ (thank) her properly, but I never got the chance.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with prefer (to / -ing / …to… / …rather than…).

items.prompt: He prefers cycling ____ taking the bus.
I prefer to stay at home ____ go out.
She prefers ____ (read) books to watching TV.
I prefer to eat early ____ late.
They prefer ____ (live) in a small town.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with would prefer (to…) or would rather (base verb).

items.prompt: I’d prefer ____ (not / drive) in this snow.
I’d rather ____ (walk) than take a taxi.
Would you prefer ____ (eat) now or later?

exercises.instruction: Complete with than (would rather … than …).

items.prompt: I’d rather stay at home ____ go out.
We’d rather wait here ____ leave now.
He’d rather take a taxi ____ walk in the rain.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences (I’d rather you did/didn’t …).

items.prompt: I’d rather you ____ (not / smoke) in here.
I’d rather you ____ (be) on time tomorrow.
I’d rather you ____ (not / phone) me after 10.
I’d rather they ____ (not / come) too early.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences. Use a preposition + -ing.
Complete the sentences with by + -ing.

items.prompt: You can open it ____ (turn) the key.
He improved his English ____ (practise) every day.
I solved the problem ____ (restart) the computer.
You can lose weight ____ (eat) less sugar.
They found the address ____ (ask) a neighbour.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with the -ing form after before/after/by/without.

items.prompt: After ____ (finish) dinner, we went for a walk.
I managed to do it by ____ (work) late.
Before ____ (go) to bed, I set an alarm.
She got the job by ____ (impress) the interviewers.
I learned a lot by ____ (make) mistakes.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences. Here to is a preposition, so use to + -ing.

items.prompt: I’m not used ____ (get) up so early.
